node.title: ‘Single All the Way’ Review: Cookie Cutter Christmas
node.description: This Netflix holiday rom-com rests its family-friendly shenanigans on a display of chemistry that never materializes.

node.title: ‘Red Pill’ Review: The Horror of a Weekend of Racism and Extremism
node.description: Tonya Pinkins is in the director’s chair for this bizarre face-off between political opponents in which rhetoric is the least of the weapons.

node.title: Best Jazz Albums of 2021
node.description: In a year of continued uncertainty, musicians held their colleagues, and listeners, close.

node.title: Best Albums of 2021
node.description: Less isolation didn’t mean a return to normalcy. Albums with big feelings and room for catharsis made the most powerful connections.

node.title: The C.F.P.B. says it will scrutinize banks that rely heavily on overdraft charges.
node.description: The consumer bureau’s chief says too many banks are hooked on “exploitive junk fees.”

node.title: Mumps Symptoms in Children Explained As CDC Finds Most Cases Among Vaccinated
node.description: Despite a rise in cases in vaccinated children, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say that the MMR vaccine is still the best way to prevent mumps.

node.title: 3D Printing 'Legend' Sanjay Mortimer Dies, Prompting Flood of Tributes
node.description: Mortimer, who was in his thirties when he died, was known for co-founding the popular E3D 3D printing company less than a decade ago.

node.title: Elon Musk Says People Over 70 Should Not Run for Office in Apparent Dig at Biden and Trump
node.description: The Tesla founder tweeted what he believed should be the age limit for politicians seeking power.

node.title: The Longest Jail Sentences Over January 6 Capitol Breach—So Far
node.description: More than 120 individuals have pleaded guilty to charges, with 11 handed custodial sentences.

node.title: Chicago Drops Lawsuit Against Police Union Over Vaccine Mandate
node.description: Mayor Lori Lightfoot pledged to take the matter back to court if the police union takes "further action toward encouraging an illegal work stoppage or strike."

node.title: DoorDash Driver Praised Online for Completing Delivery After Auto Accident
node.description: Despite another vehicle crashing into her car, the DoorDash driver made sure to complete the delivery before reacting.

node.title: U.N. Seats Denied, for Now, to Afghanistan’s Taliban and Myanmar’s Junta
node.description: A powerful United Nations committee deferred a decision on applications by the ruling authorities of both countries, widely regarded as pariahs, to replace envoys of the governments they had toppled.

node.title: Abortion at the Court
node.description: The Supreme Court seems likely to undermine or overturn Roe v. Wade.

node.title: Cuomo Nemesis Is Charged With Campaign Fraud
node.description: Steve McLaughlin, a Republican county executive and a former state lawmaker, was accused of using campaign funds to pay a personal debt.

node.title: Fingerprint leads to arrest in killing of woman in 1983
node.description: Carla Lowe had last been seen waiting for a train at an Amtrak station in Delray Beach but she never made it on board.

node.title: The Art Basel Circus Comes to Town
node.description: Parties were held for Tag Heuer and Jean Paul Gaultier at Faena.

node.title: Meghan wins court battle with British tabloid that published private letter to her father
node.description: The decision spares the Duchess of Sussex from having to appear at a trial in which her estranged father Thomas Markle would also have given evidence.

node.title: NSW Health confirms eighth Omicron case flew in on Singapore flight, as more exposure sites named
node.description: NSW Health says two new cases of the Omicron COVID-19 variant were recorded in the state today, with at least two others under investigation.

node.title: U.K. appeals court sides with Meghan in battle vs. tabloid publisher
node.description: The court dismissed the newspaper group's appeal against an earlier ruling finding it had illegally violated the Duchess of Sussex's privacy by publishing parts of a letter to her father.

node.title: ‘Where is **?’: Fans in China Elude Censors to Talk About Peng Shuai
node.description: She is not the first celebrity to be scrubbed from the internet, but her supporters are finding creative ways to voice their frustration.

node.title: MLB Lockout: Players Association and Commissioner's Statements in Full
node.description: The MLBPA called the lockout a "dramatic measure," after commissioner Rob Manfred said he hoped it would "jumpstart the negotiations."

node.title: Heisman Trophy Voters Face Conundrum as Few Games Remain and No Clear Frontrunner
node.description: A defensive end could win this year's coveted trophy, or perhaps someone who doesn't even play on championship weekend.

node.title: Beto O'Rourke's Path to Governor Runs Through Latino Voters, But They're No Sure Thing
node.description: Beto O'Rourke did well with Latinos in 2018, but it wasn't enough to win. Now he faces Governor Greg Abbott, who fared better with Hispanics in 2018 than Ted Cruz did against the Democrat.

node.title: I.O.C., on Defensive, Says It Held Second Call With Peng Shuai
node.description: Olympic officials said they ‘shared the same concern as many’ about the safety of the Chinese tennis star but offered no details of what they discussed with her.

node.title: Donald Trump Boasts January 6 Rally Was 'Largest Crowd' He's Ever Spoken To
node.description: The former president told Nigel Farage in an interview that "nobody ever talks" about the size of the crowd that contained those who went on to storm Capitol.

node.title: Donald Trump Taunts Stacey Abrams Over Georgia Run: 'I'll Beat Her Again'
node.description: If Abrams is successful in 2022, she will become the first Black governor of Georgia and the first Black woman to serve as a governor in the United States.

node.title: Court hears of strangulation injuries at sentencing of campground abductor
node.description: The defence for a man jailed over abducting a five-year-old girl from a campground in Tasmania tells a court he has had to "deal with emotive media coverage" while in prison.

node.title: Historic Jackson Heights or Astoria Waterfront? A Chicago Transplant Considers Queens.
node.description: When two of her children landed in New York City, a Midwestern doctor took her $850,000 budget to Queens for a two-bedroom apartment close by. Which one would you choose?

node.title: Shifting Styles and Blue Moods in the Pages of a Graphic Novel
node.description: Ed Park’s latest Graphic Content column looks at new work from Matt Madden and R. Kikuo Johnson.

node.title: Veteran Authors and Mistletoe Descend on the Best-Seller List
node.description: But where are the menorahs and Kwanzaa candles?
